intro: Lastreopsis fideleae, commonly known as the velvetleaf *Lastreopsis*, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
